intro: Chamaesyce ocellata subsp. rattanii, commonly known as the rattan leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in cyathia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its ecological role remains under-researched.
